ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron continued to walk beside Dinobot, well aware of the small fox ‘bot’s presence behind them. She had nothing against him, just as long as he stayed

Tavatron continued to walk beside Dinobot, well aware of the small fox 
�bot�s presence behind them. She had nothing against him, just as long as he 
stayed out of her way. At the moment, however, she was glad for his help. He 
obviously knew more about transformer physiology than she. Basic first aid 
knowledge was required in the forces, but it would take more than her 
limited training to repair Dinobot�s extensive damage. She wasn�t going to 
lie to herself, she was worried about him. She had no way of accurately 
gauging just how badly he was injured, but she did know that a non TM2 would 
have died from fluid loss a long time ago.

The relief she felt upon seeing the doors of the CF was enough to make her 
want to collapse where she stood. She was tired, dead tired. All she wanted 
to do was curl up in a nice �R chamber and sleep the past few days away. It 
had been rough, but nothing she wasn�t trained to handle. Dinobot, however, 
deserved a rest more than any of them. One thing was bothering her, however, 
why hadn�t Dinobot used his own repair system? She had seen him use it 
before, though the mechanics of it escaped her at the moment, she did know 
it was very effective.

She never really had the chance to look at this ship. Now, as she neared it, 
she realized just how powerful a weapon it was. This ship was exactly what 
the Maximal forces needed right now. The automated guns mounted on various 
sections of its outer hull looked rather impressive, and quite powerful. The 
primary cannon mounted atop the massive ship was like nothing she had ever 
seen before, then again she still fought with a sword and staff, practically 
anything could be classified as more advanced. However, a weapon in the 
proper hands could be just as deadly as any plasma rifle.

Tavatron followed closely beside Dinobot as they entered the massive ship. 
The sudden onslaught of artificial light caused her to instinctively raise 
her arm and blink reflexively. Almost immediately the feeling passed, her 
systems automatically adjusting to her current surroundings. The mechanical 
iris in her optics tightened to a mere pinhole, and was invisible to the 
naked eye unless it was active. Tavatron�s gaze wandered about the ship, it 
proved to be just as formidable as she had originally thought.

She turned to Dinobot, up until now he had been rather quiet, perhaps it was 
for the best, he needed to conseve his energy. She opened her mouth, as if 
she were about to say something, but was suddenly cut-off by the low-level 
chirp of her comm system:

"Acknowledged, we�re on our way. Tavatron out."

Tavatron turned, and sure enough there were the arrows. Tavatron began to 
follow them, it seemed everything would turn out alright after all.
